resources.string: Before you start anything, it is important to know the reason for why you want to learn a particular language. For example, you may be learning to be able to play video games in that language, or perhaps for work. Deciding your purpose helps in the next step.

Whether it is through TV shows or video games, it is important to listen to the spoken language so that you can understand speech patterns. Try viewing your favorite media in your language of choice while breaking down the grammar structure and vocabulary that you can pick up.

Find people to practice speaking in your given language to. If you do not know anyone who speaks the language, try to find online communities that communicate in this language. Bonus points if you dive into a native-only online community.

Do your best to include the language in your everyday life. This can include visiting the aforementioned online communities daily, consuming media in this language, or even trying to think in the new language.

As you repeat the activities noted in the previous steps, you will eventually find that you have gained a natural, albeit limited, understanding of your target language. The final step will need to be repeated over and over: Find educational resources to learn reading and writing to build on the knowledge that you now have.
